page.title: 05Station Lane, Barton
page.content:
Station Lane has been known at various times as Carter's Lane, School Lane, Cobbett's Lane and Boggart House Lane.
John Carter was priest at the Catholic chapel of St Lawrence at Newhouse from 1745-89. St Mary's chapel was built in 1806 and the present church was built in 1906 at the expense of William Smith of Newsham House.
The name Cobbett dates from the visit of the Radical candidate in the Preston election of 1826 to Barton and his discussions with the parish priest.
A carving of a boggart or sprite can be seen over the door of Boggart's Farm opposite the school.
Station lane crosses the railway by the old station, now used as a house.
